title: Trello
summary: Trello is a collaboration tool that creates a shared perspective on any project.
description: Trello gives you perspective over all your projects, at work and at home.Whether it's managing a team, writing an epic screenplay, or just making a grocery list, Trello is your sidekick for getting things done and staying organized.With Trello you can:â€¢ Create boards to organize anything you're working on.â€¢ Use them solo or invite coworkers, friends and family to collaborate.â€¢ Customize workflows for different projectsâ€¢ Add checklists of "To-Dos" on cardsâ€¢ Assign tasks to yourself and coworkersâ€¢ Comment on items with your friendsâ€¢ Attach files from Google Drive and Dropboxâ€¢ Upload photos and videosâ€¢ Reply to comments from Android Wearâ€¢ Display cards in a calendar view with the Calendar Power-Upâ€¢ Work offline and boards will sync automatically when reconnectedTrello is free to use forever."Trello is one of those few apps that actually balances both a simple, elegant user interface and powerful, flexible features." - Lifehacker
descriptionHTML:
Trello gives you perspective over all your projects, at work and at home.

Whether it's managing a team, writing an epic screenplay, or just making a grocery list, Trello is your sidekick for getting things done and staying organized.

With Trello you can:

• Create boards to organize anything you're working on.
• Use them solo or invite coworkers, friends and family to collaborate.
• Customize workflows for different projects
• Add checklists of "To-Dos" on cards
• Assign tasks to yourself and coworkers
• Comment on items with your friends
• Attach files from Google Drive and Dropbox
• Upload photos and videos
• Reply to comments from Android Wear
• Display cards in a calendar view with the Calendar Power-Up
• Work offline and boards will sync automatically when reconnected

Trello is free to use forever.

"Trello is one of those few apps that actually balances both a simple, elegant user interface and powerful, flexible features." - Lifehacker
comments: Really good for working collaboratively on projects. For more  personal use it would be great if you could move the cards on the page that collates all your cards from different boards into an order you plan to do them (without faffing about with putting a due date on them that is liable to change). Even better would be if you could move the cards around in a quadrant: bottom left = easy, not important, top left = easy, important, top right = difficult, important, bottom right normally = difficult, not important, but I list my personal to-dos in here eg buy birthday pressie, wash car, book hair etc! Hope you might consider this functionality - would make my life complete! ðŸ˜‰ But great work so far! ðŸ˜Š. Thanks!

It's a good app! The bug invloving picture orinetation on v30 has been fixed in latest update. The support team took initiative and worked with me to get the bug sent to the tech team. Very impressed!

When replying to someone's comment, I would like to see it as you would in Facebook (tiered comments). This would make it easier to know which comments relate to which. As of now, there is no structure to them and it can be confusing especially if you all looking at a card that is not current.

The best cross-platform way of planning together and sharing progress. Every now and then it would be nice to have a few features like swimlanes for subtasks etc but that could just be that I'm way to demanding from my background in software engineering
Why do i have to add myself to members to see a card in the widget each time i create a card? It's a bit complicated but boy is it feature rich.
Trello is awesome for making lists and categorizing them, but there's no way to alphabetize items in a list. Please add an option to do this!
recentChanges: - You can now change the permissions of board members. Invite everyone to administrate your boards!
(DISCLAIMER LEGAL MADE ME PUT IN: For security reasons, Trello does not advise that you make everyone in the world an administrator of your boards.)
- We've boosted performance for those of you with particularly large boards. We're no longer unintentionally punishing those of you who enjoy Trello to the max.
